structured_content.summary: Run Card — Multi-Agent Code Refactor Task: Design a multi-agent system for automated code refactoring Owner: Core-Engineering-AI Urgency: Critical Tags: multi-agent, orchestration, code-generation, ci-cd, validation Constraints: Max 5 concurrent agents/task, <50ms inter-agent latency, atomic state management, Python-only, graceful error handling Interfaces: Git repos, static analysis tools, profiling tools, Redis (state), RabbitMQ (comms) Success Criteria: >95% automated refactoring success, <15 min end-to-end time per module, zero critical rollbacks post-deployment Schema: bridge … 0, "max_to
action_items: Risks & Mitigations Agent Deadlock: Orchestrator pre-validates DAG for cycles; implements timeouts
State Corruption: Atomic Redis transactions (MULTI/EXEC) for all state updates
Next Steps (with Handoff Criteria) 24–48h: Implement PlannerAgent + RefactorAgent API contracts
", "objective": "Create an autonomous system of specialized AI agents that can collaboratively plan, execute, validate, and report on code refactoring tasks with minimal human intervention

0, "max_tokens": 2500, "extra": { "workflow_type": "DAG", "max_concurrent_agents": 5, "communication_bus": "RabbitMQ", "state_store": "Redis", "agent_roles": [ "PlannerAgent", "RefactorAgent", "ValidatorAgent", "RollbackAgent", "ReportingAgent" ] } }, "validators": { "response_time_ms_max": 4500, "must_include": [ "Agent Roles & Responsibilities", "Communication Protocol", "Workflow Engine", "Handoff Criteria", "State Management" ] } }
